data.title: THE GLASS MENAGERIE by Tennessee Williams presented by Theatre Morgan
data.meta_description:
https://youtu.be/wpziCwhAbaY (promo video)

Directed by Reggie Phoenix

The Glass Menagerie, by one of America’s finest dramatists, is a memory play by Tennessee Williams that has strong autobiographical elements, featuring characters based on himself, his histrionic mother, and his mentally fragile sister Laura. The play depicts the challenges of  a son that longs to escape from his stifling home, where his mother worries about the future prospects of his fragile, shy sister. 

MDTheatreGuide review of the show:

https://mdtheatreguide.com/2019/09/theatre-review-the-glass-menagerie-at-theatre-morgan/  

 Performances:

Thursday, Oct. 3, 2019 @ 10:30am (student matinee)*

Friday, Oct. 4, 2019 @ 7:30pm                            

Saturday, Oct. 5, 2019 @ 2:00pm & 7:30pm

 Tickets:

General Admission: $20;
MSU Students/Faculty/Staff (ID req.)$10;
Non-MSU Students/Seniors (60+): $15;
Groups (10+ tickets): $15 each

*Student matinee: $5 per person

 

www.murphyfineartscenter.org

The Murphy Fine Arts Center box office: (443) 885-4440

murphyfineartscenter@morgan.edu

 

The Murphy Fine Arts Center

Turpin-Lamb Theater

2201 Argonne Drive, Baltimore, MD 21251, powered by Localist, the Community Event Platform
